experience: You and Jesse both know Bart Rupert, Aaron Bandell, and 10 others
On October 12, after three and a half incredible years, I completed my final day at Amazon with nothing lined up, taking time off to understand what else I wanted to do and where I needed to be.
Today, exactly one month and 2500 miles later, I'm getting ready for my first day at Geocaching HQ and living walking distance from work in my favorite city!

Throughout the job search I listened to my gut instinct and insisted on the highest standards for myself, viewing the interview process as a two-way relationship. It wasn't easy and there were times I had to make tough decisions but GAH, it was totally worth it in the end.
Personal branding played a pivotal role in this process.
Now here I am. I still can't believe this is happening!
SEATTLE FRIENDS: If you hear about a man skipping down Fremont Avenue to work high-fiving strangers today, that's me!
As you're writing your holiday gift lists, remember the kids at Cope Boys & Girls Club of Metro Denver.  Help BrieBug support Giving Day Denver : https://hubs.ly/H096hfS0

Join us Wednesday, November 8th, at BrieBug-DTC for a quick introduction to Service Workers, a progressive upgrade for the web that allows you to cache data, and much more! RSVP here: https://hubs.ly/H091r1V0
ICYMI - Our Angular CDK + Packaging Component Libraries meetup is Wednesday night at the BrieBug office! RSVP here - https://hubs.ly/H08-txj0
CEO, architect, and senior software developer primarily focused on developing MEAN stack single page applications (SPA) using Mongo, Express, Angular, and Node.

Contract with FlatIrons Solutions helping them build a system for one of their client to track deliverable items. The single page app is built using Ember, CQ5, and various JavaScript libraries including ember, handlebars, bootstrap, karma, lodash, jqGrid, moment, toastr, and many others . My duties include the design of their custom JavaScript data layer, assisting/mentoring other developers, automated testing design using karma with qUnit, and everyday development tasks to build pages and address bug reports. Also worked on AngularJS documentum based application for managing and annotating media such as images and video.

A four month project to help the organization get control of their build and packing system, Mondor (custom built application based on Maven).  Wrote multiple utilities to search for XML files containing inversion of control, parse the XML, and update dependency files for assemblies.  Successfully completed the project and created a repeatable, documented process for them to follow in the future.

6+ month contract helping Pensco redesign their internal and external applications using twitter bootstrap, JavaScript, and lots of supporting JavaScript libraries to bring them cutting edge client side applications that meet the needs of their customers.  Technologies used include ASP.NET MVC 4, Web API, RequireJS, Query UI Widget Factory, JavaScript, Facebook, Underscore, and several other JavaScript libraries to create a client rich experience.
JavaScript Frameworks - AngularJS, ExpressJS, EmberJS, Knockout.js, Backbone.js, YUI, ExtJS, jQuery
interests: JavaScript Frameworks - AngularJS, ExpressJS, EmberJS, Knockout.js, Backbone.js, YUI, ExtJS, jQuery

summary: I am the founder and CEO of BrieBug, a premier broker of technology solutions. I learned to code BASIC at 13 years old on my TRS80 Color Computer and started as a developer over 20 years ago on the Microsoft stack using VB4. I founded BrieBug 9 years ago and have built a team of talented developers dedicated to delivering cutting edge enterprise solutions. I'm an expert in JavaScript languages, including Angular and React. When I'm not busy running a software business, I enjoy skiing and cycling in my home state of Colorado. My other hobbies include spending time with my three kids and their dog, Sparkle.BrieBug provides teams of cohesive JavaScript developers, without the hassles of countless interviews. We are a complete team, not individuals. We have common goals with your team and integrate with them seamlessly, ensuring we’re all pulling in the same direction.  We are JavaScript experts and we share our knowledge base and industry best practices with your team. Let us help you deliver your next Angular, React, or JavaScript application.
name: Jesse Sanders
title: CEO, BrieBug | Providing teams of talented developers for our clients.
